title: Virtual Environment-Based Patient Education Program Design for Radiation Therapy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Medical Terminology and Fundamental Concepts in Radiation Therapy
context.additional_context: A program focused on enhancing radiation therapy patient education competencies for novice healthcare professionals, utilizing experiential content developed and applied through virtual learning tools similar to the VERT/PEARL system.

learning_goals: Through virtual environment simulations, learners can explain radiation therapy procedures and equipment usage with 90% accuracy.
Via role-play-based PBL activities, learners can identify at least three real-world issues in patient education and propose response strategies.
Learners can present improvement plans that enhance the effectiveness of patient education materials related to radiation therapy by over 80% through formative assessment.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
